revised_title: Teredo Navalis and Limnoria Terebrans: Observations on Their Destruction of Timber
tldr: The author, William Thompson, refutes the claim that Teredo navalis, a destructive marine animal, is no longer found on the British coast. He presents evidence of specimens found in Portpatrick and discusses their method of consuming and destroying timber. Additionally, he describes the Limnoria terebrans, another crustacean that causes extensive damage to wood, often working alongside the Teredo navalis.
